verses.text: ¶ Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,

¶     For that the leaders took the lead in Israel,
    For that the people offered themselves willingly,
    Bless ye Jehovah.

Jehovah, when thou wentest forth out of Seir,
    When thou marchedst out of the field of Edom,
    The earth trembled, the heavens also dropped,
    Yea, the clouds dropped water.
The mountains [a]quaked at the presence of Jehovah, Even yon Sinai at the presence of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
¶ In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, In the days of Jael, [b]the highways were unoccupied, And the travellers walked through [c]byways.
[d]The rulers ceased in Israel, they ceased, Until that I Deborah arose, That I arose a mother in Israel.

They chose new gods;
    Then was war in the gates:
    Was there a shield or spear seen
    Among forty thousand in Israel?
My heart is toward the governors of Israel, [e]That offered themselves willingly among the people: Bless ye Jehovah.

footnotes.e: Or, Ye that offered yourselves willingly among the people, bless etc.

verses.text:
Tell , ye that ride on white asses,
    Ye that sit on rich carpets,
    And ye that walk by the way.

[f]Far from the noise of archers, in the places of drawing water, There shall they rehearse the righteous acts of Jehovah, the righteous acts [g]of his rule in Israel. Then the people of Jehovah went down to the gates.

footnotes.f: Or, Because of the voice of the archers . . . there let them rehearse

verses.text: [h]Then came down a remnant of the nobles [i] the people; Jehovah came down for me [j]against the mighty.

footnotes.h: Or, Then go down, O remnant, for the nobles . . . O Jehovah, go down for me against the mighty. Or, Then made he a remnant to have dominion over the nobles and the people; Jehovah made me have dominion over the mighty

footnotes.i: Or, as otherwise read, the people of Jehovah came down for me against (or among) the mighty

verses.text:
Why sattest thou among the sheepfolds,
    To hear the pipings for the flocks?
    At the watercourses of Reuben
    There were great searchings of heart.
Gilead abode beyond the Jordan: And Dan, why did he remain in ships? Asher sat still at the [n]haven of the sea, And abode by his creeks.

Zebulun was a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death,
    And Naphtali, upon the high places of the field.

¶     The kings came and fought;
    Then fought the kings of Canaan,
    In Taanach by the waters of Megiddo:
    They took no gain of money.

From heaven fought the stars,
    From their courses they fought against Sisera.
The river Kishon swept them away, That ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, [o]march on with strength.

Then did the horsehoofs stamp
    By reason of the prancings, the prancings of their strong ones.
Curse ye Meroz, said the angel of Jehovah. Curse ye bitterly the inhabitants thereof, Because they came not to the help of Jehovah, To the help of Jehovah [p]against the mighty.

He asked water,  she gave him milk;
    She brought him butter in a lordly dish.
¶ Through the window she looked forth, and cried, The mother of Sisera through the lattice, Why is his chariot so long in coming? Why tarry the [t]wheels of his chariots?
Her wise ladies answered her, [u]Yea, she returned answer to herself,

footnotes.u: Or (Yet she repeateth her words unto herself)

verses.text:
Have they not found, have they not divided the spoil?
    A damsel, two damsels to every man;
    To Sisera a spoil of dyed garments,
    A spoil of dyed garments embroidered,
    Of dyed garments embroidered on both sides, on the necks of the spoil?

So let all thine enemies perish, O Jehovah:
    But let them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in his might.
    ¶ And the land had rest forty years.
